comment: I'm a CRJU major and I can say very easily that he is the best professor I've had at KSU. I had him as my last class of the day right after biology and he made the pain of bio go away! His class is absurdly easy and he's such a great person, he made me really enjoy history so much that I casually integrated stuff in class when talking to friends.

I wish Dr. Stearns could teach all of my classes. His lectures are entertaining and he tells you specifically what to need to know for the test. He also lets you use a note card on tests. The tests are super straightforward and final is optional. He is incredibly caring about his students and the material. He often lets out class early! Great time!

Stearns is one of the best professors at KSU. Wants you to succeed & provides several extra-credit. You cover a lot but its fascinating. Stearns even gives you a 5-minute break during class! You are allowed (at least) one-sided notecard on each test and can put any notes you want on it. He understands students in a way that most professors dont.
He made history interring even for ESL students & surely you can pass his class if you consider his night class. Great part-time Prof @ KSU

Stearn's is the best! You will have to purchase or rent a textbook but you will not have to read from it. He only has you write down "textbook terms" that he chooses and puts on the tests. Each test is 50 questions, 25 from textbook terms and 25 from lecture. He tells you specifically what will be covered on the test. 5x8 notecard for tests!
He is an awesome professor and makes history interesting. One of the best professors ever!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: hilarious, great guy. he makes history entertaining. he highlights what on the power points will be on the test and lets you make a big note card for tests. you need the textbook but only to put terms on your note card for the test. the tests a difficult but the note cards help a lot. easy extra credit opportunities for tests grades after tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Stearns is a wonderful professor at KSU. He understand that everyone in his class isn't a history major and doesn't make the class impossible. He allows a 5x8 cheat sheet on the test which is so helpful. Although attendance isn't mandatory, he bumps up to 3 points if you have perfect attendance. Take him if possible!

HE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR TO TAKE FOR HISTORY 2112!!!! He lets you have a little cheat sheet on the test. Make sure the be as detailed as possible! I recommend typing it up and making the font as small as possible. This really helps because the test questions are very specific. He is a great lecturer and is SUPER funny!

Stearns was one of the best profs I ever had at KSU. I loved him and the enthusiasm he brought to class every time. Grading was clear: 3 tests included lecture and txtbk terms and 5x8 card was allowed on each test. Optional final and bonuses given. Just do what he asks, show up to class and take notes how he wants it, and you'll be fine. Easy A!

Dr. Stearns also teaches at Young Harris College full-time so if that's not an indication of his passion for teaching then good luck finding someone else as authentic and interesting as Dr. Stearns. He is such an amazing teacher and I genuinely enjoyed going to class. He's funny, sarcastic, and has exactly my type of humor. I highly recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Only graded on 3 tests, but given a test sheet that essentially outlines the test for you and you can have a 5x8 notecard for each test. Doesn't make attendance mandatory, but you would be better off going to most classes; he gives a lot of information that will be on the test word for word and is generally an engaging speaker and funny person.

He is soo good. His lectures are based on the powerpoint that he shows during class and a lot of the time, you don't really need to pay attention. The outline he gives you for the test is a little confusing, but you get a 5 by 8 notecard to have anything you want on it for the test. TAKE HIM!

He is AMAZING, his class really helped me to understand Modern American History to a point where I want to pursue more knowledge. His class is dead simple, he has one long power point he uses for the entire semester, with fantastic analogies and corny humor. 3 Tests and an optional final. I loved his class so much
Great professor with fun lectures. always making jokes. extra credit opportunity with each test. Go to class and with a little studying, you'll get an A

Really chill professor, his comedy makes the lectures much more interesting. He gives a lot of extra credit opps to make up for the fact that your only grades will be 4 tests and an optional final. BTW the term sheets he gives outlines exactly what to expect on the test, so no need to over study and only follow that

Dr. Stearns is the best professor I have ever had, hands down. He is a great teacher who knows the material well and keeps you engaged. I genuinely looked forward to going to his class to learn new material about US history. Enjoyable lectures and an easy A if you put in the minimal effort that is required to succeed. If you can take him, TAKE HIM.

Super chill and a great guy. Easy class if you go to it and study. You don't really need the book; I found everything online and did fine. But you really do need to study - your grade is determined by 4 tests and an optional final. Overall - easy class and a great professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He makes lectures enjoyable with his sense of humor. Gives a lot of bonus point opportunities and is easy to approach for help. Literally gives you a 5 x 8 notecard for each test.

This dude is super chill. He is my favorite teacher ever. He always gives extra credit before test and if you have perfect attendance you get 6 points. The test are hard but he allows you to bring a cheat sheet for the test. Only 3 test and the last one is optional. Take his class, it is worth it. I would take him again.
Best teacher I have ever had. Only 3 tests all year are the only grades. Optional final as well. If you have perfect attendance he gives you up to 6 bonus points.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: I enjoyed this man so much! He is so fun and he is a very easy professor. There are 3 tests and an optional final. He allows a note card and he gives extra credit. The tests are a little tough, but go to every class and you'll get 4 points added to your final grade. I made B's on every test and made an A with those bonus points!

Received a C in this class but the teacher is literally so easy. Easiest class I've actually taken in college. Unfortunately, I work an hour and a half away from campus so I was NEVER able to make it to class which is why I got a C. I was able to teach myself almost all of the info and if you can make it to class you WILL get an A. so easy.

Wonderful professor! His lectures are so fun. He provides a study guide for all of his tests and you get a notecard for tests. 4 points added to you average for perfect attendance. Not a lot of work. Great dude. Definitely take him!
rating_tags: Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: Professor Stearns is absolutely amazing. Good vibes, good sense of humor. He provides a term sheet for each test, which is basically a study guide. He also allows you to use a notecard for the test. 4 points added to your average if you have perfect attendance. I wish more professors were like him. You will not regret taking this class!

This guy is wonderful! He gives 4 points to your final grade if you attend every class. His lectures are very interesting. His test can be challenging so just make sure you study. You also are allowed to use a 5x8 note card. Only 4 tests (one is an optional final). He is funny and makes history as fun as he can. Definitely take him!!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Stearns history is the best history! You won't be bored in this class and if you pay attention and do your notecard you will for sure pass! His lectures are so funny and gives you a ton of opportunities for extra points! If you fail you probably took him for granted and skipped class

He is an amazing professor! I normally do not like history but he made this class so fun! there isn't any homework and for the tests you can use a 5x8 notecard, so you can put half the test on a notecard so you have a cheat sheet, so its almost impossible to fail! and if you go to every class he will add 4 points to your final grade!

After failing my first history class with a strict and challenging professor, I now enjoy learning about history. I often find myself completely captivated with the lectures and its similar to reading a good book. Allows a notecard for the tests. If you are never absent you recieve extra credit. How can you not pass?
Dr. Stearns has been the best professor I've ever had in college. He made the class very interesting and I love how he teaches. Take him!!! It's an easy A.

No joke- this guy is literally my favorite man on the planet. Never had a teacher care more about the students than him. He expects you to try and gets disappointed when you don't. Do what he asks you to do and it will be one of your favorite classes ever.

Stearns is amazing! Lectures are funny and actually interesting. He gives you a notecard for tests so they are super easy as long as you stick to his system. I would take him over and over again, great guy and easiest A I've ever gotten

I cannot say enough good things about this professor. EASILY the best professor I have ever had. He makes every lecture interesting with his humor and knowledge. 3 tests and a final, but you don't have to take the final if you're happy with your grade. Adds 4 pts to final grade if you have 2 or less absences. TAKE HIM you won't regret it!
